title: `remove_dir_all` can indeed follow symlinks

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
@fweimer points out that `remove_dir_all` uses system calls that follow symbolic links (see details below). This is probably a bug, especially given that the documentation of `std::fs::remove_dir_all` states:

> This function does not follow symbolic links and it will simply remove the symbolic link itself.

Probably the function should be fixed to match the documentation, since following symbolic links is problematic. Among other things, the directory tree could change while it is being read.  

<details>
<summary>strace details</summary>

```
lstat("55", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|0755, st_size=14, ...}) = 0
open("55", O_RDONLY|O_NONBLOCK|O_DIRECTORY|O_CLOEXEC) = 3
fstat(3, {st_mode=S_IFDIR|0755, st_size=14, ...}) = 0
getdents(3, /* 3 entries */, 32768)     = 72
lstat("55/a", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|0755, st_size=14, ...}) = 0
open("55/a", O_RDONLY|O_NONBLOCK|O_DIRECTORY|O_CLOEXEC) = 4
fstat(4, {st_mode=S_IFDIR|0755, st_size=14, ...}) = 0
getdents(4, /* 3 entries */, 32768)     = 72
lstat("55/a/b", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|0755, st_size=14, ...}) = 0
open("55/a/b", O_RDONLY|O_NONBLOCK|O_DIRECTORY|O_CLOEXEC) = 5
fstat(5, {st_mode=S_IFDIR|0755, st_size=14, ...}) = 0
getdents(5, /* 3 entries */, 32768)     = 72
lstat("55/a/b/c", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|0755, st_size=6, ...}) = 0
open("55/a/b/c", O_RDONLY|O_NONBLOCK|O_DIRECTORY|O_CLOEXEC) = 6
fstat(6, {st_mode=S_IFDIR|0755, st_size=6, ...}) = 0
getdents(6, /* 2 entries */, 32768)     = 48
getdents(6, /* 0 entries */, 32768)     = 0
close(6)                                = 0
rmdir("55/a/b/c")                       = 0
getdents(5, /* 0 entries */, 32768)     = 0
close(5)                                = 0
rmdir("55/a/b")                         = 0
getdents(4, /* 0 entries */, 32768)     = 0
close(4)                                = 0
rmdir("55/a")                           = 0
getdents(3, /* 0 entries */, 32768)     = 0
close(3)                                = 0
rmdir("55")                             = 0
```

</details>


cc @rust-lang/libs
